intro: Megalastrum connexum, commonly known as the connected starflower, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Onagraceae family, which includes species such as willows and evening primroses. The plant is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with a fine layer of hair. Megalastrum connexum is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
